frameDefinitions: An Item changes its physical size.
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
A Member is semi-permanently part of a socially constructed Group.
The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
A Person is a member of an organized military organization belonging to a nation-state or similar body.
frameExamples: The pile of leaves had <t>shrunk</t> by about half after the first haul.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
Victor is <t>part</t> of the Red Crescent
Mr Smithers always <t>encourages</t> the employees to stay late and work harder.
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
The British at one point had an occupying army of over a million well-trained <t><fex name='Person'>soldiers</fex></t>.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Item</fen> whose size changes.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the expansion occurs.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The person who belongs to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
The time at which the <fen>Member</fen> is a member of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The location where the membership relationship holds.
The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
What the communication is about.
The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>Content</fen>.
An entity which the <fen>Speaker</fen> believes should participate in the action.
The time at which the lobbying occurs.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> attemtps susaion on an <fen>Addressee</fen>.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The <fen>Person</fen> is the member of the military.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Joan's new sweater</fex> shrank to a size that might fit a doll.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.
Two <fex>members</fex> of the Red Cross were here about a donation
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
